4 Vendors

Vendors are external libraries which provide more functionality and consistency to the framework avoiding re-invent the wheel and using standard techniques and methods that been proven their value by the community.

4.1 Stratio Font Icon

The official font icon of Stratio which includes the whole icons used in its apps in a Sass format to be imported easily in any project.

This vendor uses @font-face. Check the compatibility here.

Dependencies

  • settings: This library uses the $egeo-fontface-src variable.
  • tools.log: This library uses the logger tool to show debug info.

4.2 Brandon Grotesque

The Brandon Grotesque font in a Sass format to be imported easily in any project.

This vendor uses @font-face. Check the compatibility here.
Variable Default value Description
$egeo-brandon-grotesque
true
 Tell to the framework wheter or not the font Brandon Grotesque have to be installed.

Dependencies

  • settings: This library uses the $egeo-fontface-src variable.
  • tools.log: This library uses the logger tool to show debug info.

4.2 Droid Sans Mono

The Droid Sans Mono font in a Sass format to be imported easily in any project.

This vendor uses @font-face. Check the compatibility here.
Variable Default value Description
$egeo-droid-sans-mono
true
 Tell to the framework wheter or not the font Droid Sans Mono have to be installed.

Dependencies

  • settings: This library uses the $egeo-fontface-src variable.
  • tools.log: This library uses the logger tool to show debug info.

4.3 Open Sans

The Open Sans font in a Sass format to be imported easily in any project.

This vendor uses @font-face. Check the compatibility here.
Variable Default value Description
$egeo-open-sans
true
 Tell to the framework wheter or not the font Open Sans have to be installed.

Dependencies

  • settings: This library uses the $egeo-fontface-src variable.
  • tools.log: This library uses the logger tool to show debug info.

4.4 Sanitize

The Sanitize library was created by Jonathan Neal, co-creator of Normalize.css, and it is a revision and update over Normalize.css focused in the last versions of browsers, including mobile, and even new ones like Microsoft Edge and much more.

By Default, Sanitize is active and will be included in the final CSS generated. However, we can avoid the use of Sanitize putting to false the variable $egeo-sanitize.

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-sanitize
true
 Tell to the framework wheter or not Sanitize have to be installed.

Compatibility

Compatible in Android 4.3-4.4+, Chrome 39-45+, Edge 12+, Firefox 34-40+, Internet Explorer 9-11, iOS 7-8+, Safari 7-9+, Windows Phone 8.1+

CC0 1.0 Public Domain | github.com/jonathantneal/sanitize.css
Created using kss-node and kss-node-template.
